Here is the previous chat, use the skill previus conversatin to see what we have and also here is the last one we awas on so Make sure you're starting from the correct one also you asked what should we build first just stored in the order that was listed from the options 
â—� Good, I've got context. The mobile app currently has:
  - 6 screens: SessionPicker, SessionSetup, LiveSession, StreamerDashboard, PodcastDashboard, CaptureScreen
  - 5 workflows: Streamer, Writers Room, Brainstorm, Debate, Podcast
  - Basic features: Session start/stop, clip capture, WebSocket event streaming

  Let me start with a clarifying question:

  ---
  When you say "better feed management" and "starting streams", which scenario matters most to you?

  1. Remote OBS Control - Start/stop streaming, switch scenes, toggle sources from your phone while away from your desk
  2. Multi-Source Dashboard - See multiple incoming feeds (camera, screen, chat) and manage which ones are active
  3. Pre-Stream Checklist - Step-by-step setup wizard ensuring OBS, audio, overlays are ready before going live
  4. Quick Session Launch - One-tap to start everything (OBS streaming + session recording + AI agents) simultaneously

> 1 is good for the mobile and 2 3 and 4 are good for desktop/web and 4 is good for the 4 also. 1
can be for that opton but also its  good for mobile record video sources feature as well

â—� Got it! So for mobile, we're focusing on:
  - Remote OBS Control - control OBS from your phone
  - Quick Session Launch - one-tap to start everything
  - Mobile as Video Source - phone camera feeds into the workflow

  ---
  For the mobile video recording feature, which use case fits best?

  1. Phone as Secondary Camera - Stream your phone's camera to OBS as another scene source (like a "roaming cam" or close-up shot)
  2. Standalone Mobile Recording - Record directly on phone when you're away from OBS entirely (like on-location content)
  3. Both - Switch between "connected to OBS" mode and "standalone recording" mode depending on situation

> 3

â—� Perfect - flexible dual-mode recording makes sense.

  ---
  For the AI agents on mobile, what kind of real-time assistance matters most during a live session?

  1. Notifications Only - Phone buzzes when AI detects something notable (clip-worthy moment, topic change, action item) - you glance and continue
  2. Quick Actions - See AI suggestions and tap to approve/dismiss (e.g., "AI found a great quote - tap to save")
  3. Full Dashboard - Live feed of all AI-generated artifacts (clips, quotes, chapters) with ability to edit/curate in real-time
  4. Voice Commands - Hands-free control ("Hey FluxBoard, mark that as a clip" / "Save last 30 seconds")

> All these options are important for the mobile so you can Add all four of these options

â—� Ambitious - I like it! All four interaction modes for a complete mobile AI copilot experience.

  ---
  Last question before I present the design: For implementation, which should we build first?

  1. OBS Control + Quick Launch first - Get the core streaming controls working, then layer in AI features
  2. AI Notifications + Quick Actions first - Start with the AI-powered assistance since OBS control already partially exists in desktop companion
  3. Mobile Recording first - Phone camera capture is foundational, everything else builds on having local video
  4. Build in parallel - Tackle OBS controls, mobile recording, and AI notifications simultaneously as separate feature tracks
